card.summary: A unique religious building that reflects centuries of Islamic and Christian history, famous for its forest of arches and later cathedral structure.
card.style: Islamic architecture with later Christian additions
facts: Originally built as a mosque during the Umayyad Caliphate.
A Renaissance cathedral was constructed inside the mosque after the Christian reconquest.
tips: Visit early in the morning for a quieter experience.
Take time to walk through the interior to appreciate the arches.
